definitions.definition: (of a surface or body) throw back (heat, light, or sound) without absorbing it.
examples: when the sun's rays hit the earth a lot of the heat is reflected back into space

definitions.definition: (of a mirror or shiny surface) show an image of.
examples: he could see himself reflected in Keith's mirrored glasses

definitions.definition: embody or represent (something) in a faithful or appropriate way.
examples: stocks are priced at a level that reflects a company's prospects
synonyms: communicate; formalevince "their expressions reflected their feelings"

definitions.definition: (of an action or situation) bring (credit or discredit) to the relevant parties.
examples: the main contract is progressing well, which reflects great credit on those involved

definitions.definition: bring about a good or bad impression of.
examples: the incident reflects badly on the operating practices of the airlines
synonyms: bring into disrepute "stunts like these reflect badly on our school"

examples: he reflected with sadness on the unhappiness of his marriage
synonyms: turn over in one's mind; archaicpore on "he reflected on his responsibilities"
